Tau tool

Visualize the impact of atmospheric opacity on rover instruments and data to help scientists reduce mission planning time.

THE CHALLENGE

The Mars 2020 mission requires operation teams to reduce daily rover planning time from 12 to 5 hours. Understanding the Martian atmospheric opacity can help scientists and engineers optimize planning time. We are designing a tool that visualizes atmospheric opacity and its impacts on rover instruments.

ROLE

  • Collaborators: Yomna Hawas, John Sykes, Angela Yung
  • User interviews, competitive assessment, research synthesis, design requirements, storyboard.

Deliverables

  • Hi-fidelity wireframes
  • Specs document
  • Product pitch video

Duration

  • Apr - Aug, '19
  • 6 months

The Experience

I storyboarded the concept to evaluate the experience & identify design iteractions.

We are currently in the process of building and testing the prototype. More details will come soon :)
